properties.name: networkIdentifier
properties.doc: Network to query for this device, or device information to enable network routing.

type.name: NetworkIdentifier
type.doc: Identifier for the network to be queried

properties.name: identifierType
properties.doc: The type of identifier for the network. one of: 'IPv4', 'IPv6', 'MSISDN', 'NetworkCode'

properties.name: identifier
properties.doc:
The network identifier, based on the identifierType: an IPv4 address, an IPv6 address, an MSISDN, or a Network Code.
A Network Code may be obtained from APC documentation or from the APC /Network:retrieve endpoint.

properties.name: latitude
properties.doc: Latitude of location to be verified

properties.name: longitude
properties.doc: Longitude of location to be verified

properties.name: accuracy
properties.doc: Accuracy expected for location verification in kilometers

properties.name: device
properties.doc: The device to find the location for. Exactly one of Network Access Code, Phone Number, IPv4 address, or IPv6 address

type.name: LocationDevice
type.doc: Device information needed by operator to provide location information. Include exactly one of these properties to identify your device.

properties.name: networkAccessIdentifier
properties.doc: External identifier or network access identifier of the device

properties.name: phoneNumber
properties.doc: Phone number in E.164 format (starting with country code), and optionally prefixed with '+'

properties.name: ipv4Address
properties.doc: The Ipv4 address

properties.name: ipv4
properties.doc: An IPv4 address. This may be specified as an exact address, or as a subnet in CIDR notation.

properties.name: port
properties.doc: User equipment port.

properties.name: ipv6Address
properties.doc: The Ipv6 address

properties.name: ipv6
properties.doc: An IPv6 address. This may be specified as an exact address, or as a subnet in CIDR notation.

properties.name: port
properties.doc: User equipment port.

properties.name: verificationResult
properties.doc: True if the location is in the specified area, False otherwise

properties.name: error
properties.doc: The error object.

properties.name: code
properties.doc: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

properties.name: message
properties.doc: A human-readable representation of the error.

properties.name: target
properties.doc: The target of the error.

properties.name: details
properties.doc: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

properties.name: innererror
properties.doc: An object containing more specific information than the current object about the error.

type.name: InnerError
type.doc: An object containing more specific information about the error. As per Azure REST API guidelines - https://aka.ms/AzureRestApiGuidelines#handling-errors.

properties.name: code
properties.doc: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

properties.name: innererror
properties.doc: Inner error.

properties.name: errorCode
properties.doc: String error code indicating what went wrong.

models.name: NetworkRetrievalResult
models.doc: The network that the device is on.

properties.name: networkCode
properties.doc: The identifier for the network. This can be used as the networkIdentifier for the service APIs.

models.name: NumberVerificationWithoutCodeContent
models.doc: Request to verify number of device - first call

properties.name: networkIdentifier
properties.doc: Identifier for the network to query for this device.

properties.name: phoneNumber
properties.doc: Phone number in E.164 format (starting with country code), and optionally prefixed with '+'

properties.name: hashedPhoneNumber
properties.doc: Hashed phone number. SHA-256 (in hexadecimal representation) of the mobile phone number in **E.164 format (starting with country code)**. Optionally prefixed with '+'.

properties.name: redirectUri
properties.doc: Redirect URI to backend application.

models.name: NumberVerificationWithCodeContent
models.doc: Request to verify number of device - second call

properties.name: apcCode
properties.doc: The code provided by APC in exchange for the operator code.

properties.name: verificationResult
properties.doc: True if number if the phone number matches the device, False otherwise

properties.name: phoneNumber
properties.doc: Phone number in E.164 format (starting with country code), and optionally prefixed with '+'

properties.name: networkIdentifier
properties.doc: Network to query for this device

properties.name: date
properties.doc: Datetime of most recent swap for SIM

models.name: SimSwapVerificationContent
models.doc: Request to verify SimSwap in period

properties.name: phoneNumber
properties.doc: Phone number in E.164 format (starting with country code), and optionally prefixed with '+'

properties.name: maxAgeHours
properties.doc: Maximum lookback for SimSwap verification

properties.name: networkIdentifier
properties.doc: Identifier for the network to query for this device.

properties.name: verificationResult
properties.doc: True if the SIM has swapped in the specified period, False otherwise

clients.name: ProgrammableConnectivityClient
clients.doc: Azure Programmable Connectivity (APC) provides a unified interface to the Network APIs of multiple Telecom Operators. Note that Operators may deprecate a Network API with less advance notice than the Azure standard, in which case APC will also deprecate that Network API.

parameters.name: endpoint
parameters.doc: An Azure Programmable Connectivity Endpoint providing access to Network APIs, for example https://{region}.apcgatewayapi.azure.com

methods.name: verify
methods.doc: Verifies whether a device is within a specified location area, defined as an accuracy (radius) around a point, specified by longitude and latitude.

operation.doc: Verifies whether a device is within a specified location area, defined as an accuracy (radius) around a point, specified by longitude and latitude.

children.name: NumberVerification
children.doc:
Number operations include Frontend Authentication.

  Users first make a call to the endpoint /Number:verify, which returns a redirect to the device's 
  Network. This is followed by the device to authenticate directly with the Network. The Network 
  responds with a token and a redirect. This token can be exchanged with APC for a code.
  
  Users make a second call to the endpoint /Number:verify including the code. The code is used 
  to verify the device number. The second response is a 200 containing the result of the query.

  For more information on the steps required to use Number Verificaiton, see the APC documentation.

methods.name: verifyWithoutCode
methods.doc: Verifies the phone number (MSISDN) associated with a device. As part of the frontend authorization flow, the device is redirected to the operator network to authenticate directly.

operation.name: verifyWithoutCode
operation.doc: Verifies the phone number (MSISDN) associated with a device. As part of the frontend authorization flow, the device is redirected to the operator network to authenticate directly.

methods.doc: Verifies if a SIM swap has been performed during a past period (defined in the request with 'maxAgeHours' attribute). Returns 'True' if a SIM swap has occured.
